rounds.comments: (Alex: Each correct response will begin with the letter "A" and end with a "D".)

clues.text: Shortened a word
Spirited someone away, likely illegally
Turned away one's eyes, from the Latin for "to turn"
Aided or assisted, specifically in the commission of a crime
Played piano at the soprano recital
In the 1950s the New York Evening this newspaper became a tabloid & "National" , eventually moving to Florida
The name of the tabloid website & TV show TMZ refers to a 30-mile zone centering on this major city
This word also used for gossip is a drinking fountain aboard ship
In 1977 Rupert Murdoch launched a gossip column originally found at & named for this page of the New York Post
Famous feuding gossip columnists in the golden age of Hollywood were Louella Parsons & this alliterative lady
"Giving me a glance of annoyance" was replaced by "giving me the" this smelly phrase
A twist on Defoe, "Girl" or "Gal" this for a female assistant was big pre-World War II
Borrowed from Italian & spelled all kinds of ways in English, it means "do you get me?"
The OED defines it as a tune that stays in your mind "especially to the point of irritation "
The medium was in its infancy in the 1930s when this word came along to mean "looking good on TV"
Won a fourth term as German chancellor in 2017
Brought a team of nurses to the Crimean War on a mail boat
Won a coin flip with David Packard for top billing
In 1839 he showed his photos to the French Academy of Sciences
Wrote "The Normal Heart", fought for AIDS research
A stroll west over the Vltava River on the Charles Bridge takes you from this capital's Old Town to the Mala Strana
Go due west on land from Newfoundland & Labrador to this large province
Head west from Toulouse to reach the Franco-Spanish "country" named for this people who have a unique language
Drive west from Maseru, capital of this country, & you arrive in South Africa--heck, drive east & you'll end up there as well
The ferry from Wellington on New Zealand's North Island to Picton on the south one goes west across this strait
In a 1985 film the "Young" this character fences against Moriarty in boarding school
In "Young Mr." this man, Henry Fonda plays an up-&-coming Illinois attorney
"The Young" this character "Chronicles" TV series featured the adventurer in his pre-college & pre-movie days
This actor shakes up the Vatican as Pius XIII, "The Young Pope" in the title of an HBO series
This actor, not Peter Boyle, is the title character in "Young Frankenstein"
In a book by Beverly Cleary, Socks is this pet, suddenly having to share the house with a new baby
A tiny one of these dinosaurs has a big problem: an impossible hug, because of his short arms!
This bedtime classic is set in "the great green room"
"One Sunday morning the warm sun came up and--pop!--out of the egg came" this title larva
She wrote about & illustrated a frog named Mr. Jeremy Fisher & a hedgehog named Mrs. Tiggy-Winkle
Spoken defamation of another is slander; this is written defamation
Facing the judge in a courtroom, the plaintiff is generally on the right & this counterpart on the left
It means permission, like to search a dwelling; the third amendment speaks of this "of the owner" of a house
The role of colleges in relation to students from the mid-1800s to the 1960s was in loco parentis, Latin for this
A lawyer who represents a soldier is called a "judge" this, another term for a lawyer

Madly in love:
"Head over ____"

Ironically:
"____ in cheek"

Laugh uncontrollably:
"Bust a ____"
Inseparable or "joined at the ____"

To be personally vested:
"Have ____ in the game"
Hey, youse guys! U.S. News raved about this sandwich from John's Roast Pork in Philadelphia
This corned beef & Swiss sandwich bearing a man's name can be served cold or grilled
Down in Miami try this nationality named grilled sandwich with ham, pork, cheese & pickles
Sliced meat, torpedo sandwich rolls (split) & cans of beef consomme are keys in a "French" this
Arby's says it put this sandwich filling on the map
Sharwa is a more accurate pronunciation as well as another name for this Himalayan people
Descendants of these Dutch settlers of the Transvaal are often called Afrikaners
Geronimo was a leader of these Native American people
Northern Norway, Sweden & Finland are home to these people also known as the Sami
The governments of Kenya & Tanzania are trying to persuade these nomadic people to make permanent settlements

Worked for Edison /
His AC lit World Expo /
Ahead of his time

Brit biologist /
Not Holmes but still Watson's pal /
A twisted ladder

Gazing into space /
Ev'ry 76 years /
His object flies by

Planning planet moves /
3 laws--first is elliptic /
German gravity

An Irish chemist /
1600s gas law man /
An improved air pump!

rounds.text: Until a 1903 secession, this country's contiguous territory spanned 2 continents
